title: Find Network or Peer is not working!
body:
<!--💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎

Hellooo! 😄 

To help us tend to your issue faster, please search our currently open issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎💎-->

# 💎 Issue
I made a public custom eth2 testnet.
So anyone can connect to my node to make a transaction in my network, and also I can use MetaMask for transaction and keep tokens.
However It's running with only one Node(Machine1) and 64 Validators, I just want to participate more node to my network to test.

But finding Network? Peer? is not working, I tried almost same command for GETH, BEACON-CHAIN when I run machine2.
How can I make machine2 automatically connect to machine1's network?

machine1 is running well at the moment
`
// machine 1 geth, beacon-chain commands
./geth --port 30303 --networkid 142536 --http --http.api eth,net,web3,engine,admin --http.addr "0.0.0.0" --http.port 8545 --http.corsdomain "" --http.vhosts "" --ws --ws.api eth,net,web3,engine,admin --ws.addr "0.0.0.0" --ws.port 8546 --authrpc.jwtsecret jwt.hex --datadir gethdata --syncmode full --allow-insecure-unlock --unlock $pubkey1

./beacon-chain --datadir beacondata --min-sync-peers 0 --genesis-state genesis.ssz --bootstrap-node= --interop-eth1data-votes --chain-config-file config.yml --contract-deployment-block 0 --chain-id 142536 --accept-terms-of-use --jwt-secret jwt.hex --suggested-fee-recipient $pubkey1 --minimum-peers-per-subnet 0 --enable-debug-rpc-endpoints --execution-endpoint gethdata/geth.ipc
`

machine2' geth keep looking for peers and beacon-chain can't connect to network
`
// machine 2 geth, beacon-chain commands
./geth --port 30304 --networkid 142536 --http --http.api eth,net,web3,engine,admin --http.addr "0.0.0.0" --http.port 8545 --http.corsdomain "" --http.vhosts "" --ws --ws.api eth,net,web3,engine,admin --ws.addr "0.0.0.0" --ws.port 8546 --authrpc.jwtsecret jwt.hex --datadir gethdata --syncmode full --allow-insecure-unlock --unlock $pubkey2

./beacon-chain --datadir beacondata --min-sync-peers 0 --genesis-state genesis.ssz --bootstrap-node= --interop-eth1data-votes --chain-config-file config.yml --contract-deployment-block 0 --chain-id 142536 --accept-terms-of-use --jwt-secret jwt.hex --suggested-fee-recipient $pubkey2 --minimum-peers-per-subnet 0 --enable-debug-rpc-endpoints --execution-endpoint gethdata/geth.ipc
`

Some more information

They are using same genesis.json, genesis.ssz files and different jwt.hex file
I'm controlling those 2 machines by my laptop which is connected to another wifi router.
Both machine connected to same router and they got private ip.
I did port forwardinf both machine's http and websocket, p2p(ex. 30303, 30304) port.
